channel.title: Best RSPS Moments
channel.description:
Interested in everyones most "momentous" moments while in the RSPS community.
Could range from a moment where you made a lot of money to a moment where you just coded something spectacular.
For me, mine was when I first started playing RSPS and thought it was the dopest shit I'd ever seen.

item.title: Best RSPS Moments
item.dc:creator: @Kiryn Kiryn
item.description:
@Kiryn wrote:

Pure_:

When I first learned how to (kind of) program I wrote some shitty soul split implementation for a top server. I also sneaked in code to give me maxed stats and 1 hit people in the wild, good times. (note: this was Exion)

Exion was simple but actually fun

Read full topic

@D3i7y wrote:

One of my favorite memories was my time at DrugScape & CheatScape. I use to play the hell out of these servers back then though i was kid still. now work and all the other bs that follows.

Read full topic

item.description:
@sinisoul wrote:

Read full topic

item.title: Best RSPS Moments
item.dc:creator: @eyeownyew Eyeownyew
item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

[quote=“JCor9, post:23, topic:551927”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=670843.msg4489122#msg4489122 date=1436315663]

IV had a few good moment but the one that stands out the most is I was playing a new server only a few hours old and it had about 7 - 8 players. I was looking in the cache and saw a text doc and it had my username and password. I deleted the cache redownloaded it and then looked in it and it had the owners pass so I logged in and gave myself 2.1b crystal keys. It was a great time!!!
[/quote]lol why the fudge was that a thing

@op too many times, a recent one is runeagent with the squad lmao

I have no idea, and I couldnt tell you why that was even in the cache but after about 2 weeks he still had no idea it was there until someone else found it and took full advantage of it.

It was people’s cheap attempt at making a “Remember me” function for the client.
They would store the credentials in the cache, and plenty of owners weren’t smart enough to remove the text file when they set up the cache downloader.
When I was helping someone with a server that had a similar system, I made sure to enter fake credentials to the text file, so anyone that did try using them it wouldn’t work.

That does make sense, I why would you have the remember me function in the cache and not the client it self? Wouldn’t it be better loaded within the client?[/quote]
it has to store the data for the remember me function somewhere. user/pass can’t be changed dynamically in code without loading from somewhere. but it shouldn’'t be stored in plaintext at the very least…

Read full topic

item.title: Best RSPS Moments
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“JCor9, post:23, topic:551927”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=670843.msg4489122#msg4489122 date=1436315663]

IV had a few good moment but the one that stands out the most is I was playing a new server only a few hours old and it had about 7 - 8 players. I was looking in the cache and saw a text doc and it had my username and password. I deleted the cache redownloaded it and then looked in it and it had the owners pass so I logged in and gave myself 2.1b crystal keys. It was a great time!!!
[/quote]lol why the fudge was that a thing

@op too many times, a recent one is runeagent with the squad lmao

I have no idea, and I couldnt tell you why that was even in the cache but after about 2 weeks he still had no idea it was there until someone else found it and took full advantage of it.

It was people’s cheap attempt at making a “Remember me” function for the client.
They would store the credentials in the cache, and plenty of owners weren’t smart enough to remove the text file when they set up the cache downloader.
When I was helping someone with a server that had a similar system, I made sure to enter fake credentials to the text file, so anyone that did try using them it wouldn’t work.

That does make sense, I why would you have the remember me function in the cache and not the client it self? Wouldn’t it be better loaded within the client?[/quote]
It was in the client.
The details were stored in the cache.

Read full topic
